name: Drury Inn & Suites Nashville Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip traveling with our 2 small dogs. Drury accepted dogs, so we tried it. It was an excellent choice. We would stay there again without the dogs. There was no doggie smell, the staff was friendly and helpful, loved the happy hour and breakfast. It was clean and we loved the General Manager. He chatted with us and was very interesting. We will be trying Drury again in other cities. Great value.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was caught off guard by the number of dogs staying here, but I made it a point to try to look and smell for evidence of prior four legged guests and there wasn't a trace.
reviews.title: PRETTY DARN GOOD

reviews.text: I did here a couple as the walls wern't real thick. We were on the north end away from the high lobby ceiling, but next to the elevator. I discovered turning the AC fan on constant, instead of auto, used as a sound machine and worked fine.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Friendly people, Great value !

reviews.text: The breakfast was great, the cocktail hour was good, and the staff were really really helpful. I would stay here again. Hard to beat the eSaver Rate.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for value, friendliness and cleanliness

reviews.text: We stayed for at this Drury Hotel for the first time the week after Christmas. It was everything it is advertised that it is , even more ! The staff is beyond helpful and very friendly. The Hotel is extremely clean, and the breakfast and dinner time "snacks" are wonderful.And great for the budget.....FREE ! It only takes a few minutes to get downtown, and many of the other places you want to go. Even being by the airport, the noise did not bother us in the least. Didn't even notice it ! The hotel desk staff was very helpful, as to offer suggestions on where to visit,where to eat, and attractions to see. Thanks Leslie ! Also the GM was very kind in the evening, just to talk to us, asking how our stay was and just offering small talk about the area..... The cleaning staff was excellent, couldn't ask for anything any better.. The only thing that was a little different for me was the pet policy. We don't travel with pets, and that is just "our preference" but it is VERY pet friendly. Again, I am not saying that it is a bad thing, but if a person has dander issues and pet allergies, you might have to reconsider staying at this hotel. We had a great first visit to Nashville and a great stay at the Drury Hotel ! I would highly recommend this hotel ! Thanks !
reviews.title: Our best hotel stay in Nashville.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great stay at Drury Inn. Had a 2 room king suite and had plenty of room. We had a smoking room which was on a seperate floor for smoking. The suite was very clean and the bed was comfortable. It was nice to have free breakfast and dinner with drinks. We will stay again.
reviews.title: Great stay and will stay again!

reviews.text: Whenever I am able to do so, I stay at a Drury Inn. The accomocations are great and they offer an evening buffet and a morning breakfast at no additional expense. Good food and
reviews.title: Drury Inns Do It All

reviews.text: good way to end your day's trip or begin your day's trip. Never had a bad experience at any Drurys that I have stayed at. I highle recommend that family owned chain to anyone seeking
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in Nashville

reviews.text: quality, good service and two meals at a very reasonable price.
reviews.title: Very nice, pet-friendly property, right off the highway at a great value.

reviews.text: George Larson
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here last month and thoroughly enjoy Drury Hotels and all that they offer. Location is fine, since we have our car and were able to quickly make it to Opry Land as well the room was clean as is the whole hotel. The snax and breakfast are just fine as we are not expecting a feast. However the friendliness of this hotel also is a great asset to all that it has to offer.
reviews.title: Great deal when on a Rd. Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to Nashville, TN to go see the Christmas decorations at the Gaylord Hotel with another couple over the past weekend. We love the Drury chain of Inn & Suites as they always have a terrific hot breakfast and the marvelous 5:30 Kickback that we use as our dinner. We used the pool and whirlpool right after check-in and had a great conversation with Scott the pool maintenence man.
reviews.title: Stayed at the Drury - Just Visited the Gaylord Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our recent Friday night stay, at the 5:30 Kickback they served hotdogs, buns, baked potatoes, Tyson hot chicken nuggets, tortilla chips with refried beans and taco meat sauce which we combined with the toss salad, shedded cheddar cheese and sour cream to make a nacho salad. When the Tyson nuggets were gone they brought out some broccoli cheddar soup. If you get hungry before or after the 5:30 Kickback, they serve free popcorn and soda from 3-10 PM. When you check-in they give each adult a drink card good for three alcoholic beverages (beer, wine, margaritas and other mixed drinks)
reviews.title: Another great stay at Drury -- and no dogs this time!

reviews.text: Breakfast had the usual cereal, juice, coffee, yogurt & fruit. But they add wonderful hot items such as: scrambled eggs, sausage patties, biscuits and gravy, French toast and make-your-own Belgian waffles.
reviews.title: a good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have 2 computer in the lobby area to use or use your own in your room - as they have free wireless internet connection. Free local & long distance phone calls for 60 minutes.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another great stay at the Drury Inn thanks to Michael Cline, Asst. Manager. All the staff were very helpful and pleasant. We have never had a bad experience staying at any Drury Inn.
reviews.title: Wonderful service

reviews.text: The Drury Inn chain does a good job providing average accommodations to business travelers. But, this cannot be said of the Nashville Airport property. Do not be fooled by other glowing write-ups you may have seen. Last week, I was given a room with a toilet that hadn't been flushed. In my first ten minutes there, a very large tentacled insect needed to be mashed against a wall. That night, the fire alarm went off twice. When I called the front desk the second time it happened, I was spoken to in an unmistakably rude manner by the attendant, who sighed into the receiver and suggested I should have known there was no fire because the alarm went off. He volunteered that kids playing around with the fire alarm is something that happens there a lot. The ultimate take away? How dare I expect anything better. Adding insult to injury, I chatted with the hotel's GM the next day. He never apologized for my front desk treatment, and bent over backwards to defend his staff rather than expressing any concern for my future business. By the way, the breakfast consisted of flavorless scrambled eggs and biscuits/gravy. The nightly nibbles were hot dogs, burgers, and other unhealthful fare.
reviews.title: Mediocrity Served Up Poorly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Drury likes to market itself as the chain where "The Extras Aren't Extra," but you cannot count on basic hospitality coming with the price of your room.
reviews.title: Great experience!!

reviews.text: We just spent the weekend at Drury Inn and it was great. The breakfast in the morning and drinks and food in the evening was great and saved us money. We also had our little Maltese with us and the hotel also had other dogs and it was so quiet. The staff was wonderful and the room was clean and smelt clean. That means alot to me. Can't stand a stinky room. We just loved the whole experience. They have a cab service they use to take you downtown and back. Would recomend to everyone!!
reviews.title: Great stay at Drury as usual

reviews.text: Drury Inn is my favorite hotel chain. Just stayed a night in Nashville. The room was nice and clean. The breakfest good as usual. Staff was friendly. Thanks again!
reviews.title: wonderful stay

aka: Drury Inn And Suites Nashville Airport
description: Drury Inn & Suites offers its guests a variety of free extras – take, for example, our free hot breakfast. At Drury, “hot” means scrambled eggs, biscuits & gravy, sausage and make-your-own Belgian waffles. In the evening, join us at our 5:30 Kickback® for free hot food and cold beverages. Our rotating menu features a variety of hot foods, baked potatoes, garden salad, beer, wine, mixed drinks and more! To burn off all of those free extras, Drury has a 24-hour exercise center and a parking lot to jog around. Lastly, Drury’s free wireless Internet and free long distance calls will ensure you can keep tabs on all of your posse back home.
